activities:
Cadence uses Employee Personal Data for business and employment purposes, including without limitation: (1) filling positions; (2) managing employees from another country; (3) conducting performance evaluations and salary, bonus and equity reviews, and other Employee reviews; (4) managing employee benefits; (5) administering employee reward and recognition programs; (6) satisfying governmental reporting and tax requirements; (7) allowing employees to access various facilities and to provide login rights to various internal company and third party applications; (8) asset management and recovery; (9) satisfying security, health and safety concerns; (10) storing and processing data, including Personal Data, in computer databases and servers located in the United States; (11) implementing and maintaining Cadence’s information technology; (12) for other employment-related and business-related purposes permitted or required under applicable local law and regulation; and (13) as otherwise required by law. 

Cadence uses Customer Personal Data for business purposes, including without limitation: (1) maintaining and supporting its products performing the requested services, and complying with its contractual obligations related thereto; (2) satisfying governmental reporting and tax requirements; (3) storing and processing data, including Personal Data, in computer databases and servers located in the United States; (4) implementing and maintaining Cadence’s information technology; (5) for other business-related purposes permitted or required under applicable local law and regulation; and (6) as otherwise required by law.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Computer Services - (CSV)Computer Software - (CSF)Electronics Industry Prod/Test Equipment - (EIP)
personaldata: Human Resources Data (i.e, personal information about Cadence's employees, past or present, collected in the context of the employment relationship), Customer Data (i.e. customer contact data).
recoursemech: Cadence will utilize the Judicial Mediation and Arbitration Service (JAMS) as an external dispute resolution service.
